basics.name: Anthony Bisulco
basics.label: Computational Engineer
basics.summary: Experienced Computational Engineer with a demonstrated history of working in higher education & private industry. Strong research professional with a Master of Engineering (MEng) in Electrical and Computer Engineering from Cornell University and a Bachelor of Science (BS) focused in Electrical and Computer Engineering from Northeastern University.

work.summary: Samsung AI Center in New York invents ground breaking technologies to solve challenging problems at the intersection of AI and robotics
highlights: Developed a FPGA accelerator using HLS and Chisel for low-bandwidth pedestrian detection on edge devices using neuromorphic vision sensors
Implemented laboratory infrastructure: code management, compute cluster management and  networking
Implemented a distributed hyperparameter tuning solution for QXplore: a novel exploration based reinforcement learning algorithm

work.summary: Departement of Energy National Laboratory. I worked on the sPhenix(particle detector) experiment on the Relativistic Heavy Ion Collider
highlights: Developed fast Python Time of Flight(TOF) signal processing algorithms for a 10ps TOF detector
Implemented Python parameter optimization algorithms using Dask(distributed computing library)
Designed a constant fraction discriminator algorithm to reduce TOF electronicsâ€™ delay from 64ps to 8ps

work.summary: Worked on the AIY projects team at Google. Developed AIY vision kit an on-device neural network accelerator for computer vision
highlights: Applied transfer learning in Tensorflow to retrain models for audio and image recognition on embedded devices
Assisted in rapid prototyping/full scale manufacturing process of developing
Traveled internationally/nationally for demoing and marketing AIY kits to distributors

work.summary: Northeastern University research laboratory working on field robotics.
highlights: Implemented a visual-based navigation technique for GPS denied urban areas using computer vision
Integrated Velodyne LIDAR and 5 Point Grey Cameras into ROS for light field array
Developed a mobile manipulation platform focusing on visual navigation/manipulation using the UR-10 ma-nipulator, Point Grey Cameras and the Warthog robot platform

work.company: Northeastern University Sensing, Imaging, Control and Actuation Laboratory
work.summary: Northeastern University research laboratory working on coded and compressive sensing imaging.
highlights: Developed an FPGA control system for a multiple-input multiple-output radar system with 400 channels
Implemented simulated annealing and compressive sensing methods for a coded imaging system
Implemented a fused millimeter/infrared imaging system for target validation

work.summary: International particle physics laboratory working at probing the inner structure of matter.
highlights: Developed array synthesis algorithms for multi-anode photomultiplier tubes for increased sensor resolution
Designed and 3D printed a fiber light guide for 85% increased sensor coverage of the photomultiplier tube
Built Spectrum a web application for laboratory simulation and experimental data comparison
Presented at an International Collaboration Conference on Tile Calorimeter Upgrades

work.company: Massachusetts Institute of Technology Lincoln Laboratories
work.summary: Federally Funded Research and Development center working on engineering projects in the interest of national security.
highlights: Adapted MATLAB image processing algorithms to an FPGA for a UAV Micro-LIDAR
Developed and implemented a configurable FPGA moving average filter for Avalanche Photo Diodes (APD)
Performed sensor characterization on APDs under varying temperature and voltage conditions

volunteer.summary: Perform medical communications over amateur radio for the Boston Marathon
Taught various classes on the weekend about digital design and embedded systems to high schools students. Also, worked with students during Friday field trips on environmental conservation activities

courses: Statistical Signal Processing and Reinforcement Learning
Adaptive Signal Processing and Digital Feedback Control
